prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop with 4 lines: - Line 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.3125, 0.0]. - Line 2: Start point at [0.3125, 0.0], end point at [0.3125, 0.3125]. - Line 3: Start point at [0.3125, 0.3125], end point at [0.0, 0.3125]. - Line 4: Start point at [0.0, 0.3125], end point at [0.0, 0.0]. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3125. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.25 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a tube or pipe** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.0594, 0.5, 0.0594]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop with 1 circle: - Circle 1: Center at [0.0969, 0.0969], radius of 0.0969. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1938. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.5 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **Final shape**: A cylindrical object with a rectangular base and a tapered top, formed by combining Part 1 and Part 2 using a join operation. The final shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.5 (rectangular base length + cylindrical height) - Width: 0.3125 (rectangular base width) - Height: 0.6875 (rectangular base height + cylindrical height)</description>
